sub_title: Professor of Economics of Education and Healthcare bij Universiteit Maastricht
summary:
Aggie Paulus studied economics at the Maastricht University School of Business and Economics (SBE) and graduated cum laude in 1990. For her master thesis, she received the first Wall Street Journal Europe Student Achievement Award. She obtained a PhD-degree in economics in 1995. She has been working at Maastricht University since 1990 (SBE and FHML) and now works at the Department of health services research. She is also a member of the management team of that department.

Aggie Paulus has gained ample experience in conducting research and acting as a (co-)promotor and/or supervisor of tens of PhD-students, researchers and postdocs. She has been involved in multidisciplinary researches, combining health economics with organizational sciences, policy sciences, health sciences, nursing sciences, HTA, law and education. She (co-)authored over 180 publications, including peer-reviewed articles in a wide range of scientific journals and books, book chapters and scientific reports. Her current academic interests particularly concern health economics, education economics and the inter-sectoral economic relationships between healthcare and education. She is chair of the Research Line 'Creating Value-Based Healthcare' within the Care and Public Health Research Institute. She is also a member of the Management Team of this Institute.

Since 1990, Aggie Paulus has also gained ample experience in the execution and management of education. Among others, she was the programme director of the master’s programme on Healthcare Policy, Innovation and Management (HPIM, 2016-2022) and a member of the steering Committee of EdView 2.0. She was also the chair of the Educational Programme Committee Health (2012-2018) and the program director of the master on Healthcare Policy, Innovation and management (2016-2022). She was a member of the Exam Committee (FHML), University Council and the funding committee of SWOL and has coordinated over 90 units and trainings.

In 1999, she was awarded the Maastricht Award for Innovative Education by Maastricht University (Wijnand Wijnen Onderwijsprijs, Universiteit Maastricht). In 2008, she was voted runner-up top dog lecturer at the Faculty of Health, Medicine and Life Sciences (FHML), while in 2011, she received the FHML-teaching award as best student supervisor in the Health Domain. In 2014 and 2017, she was nominated for the FHML-teaching award as best unit/programma/track coordinator within the Health domain. In 2016, she received the first FHML Honors Award Education Health.

awards.title: Nominatie FHML onderwijsprijs 2014 als beste blokcoördinator in het domein Health
Onderwijsprijs 'Beste Studentbegeleider Domein Health', Faculty of Health, Medicine and Life Sciences, Universiteit Maastricht, 2011
Onderwijsprijs Universiteit Maastricht (Beste Docent Universiteit Maastricht, 1999)

profile_positions.title: Professor of Economics of Education and Healthcare

profile_positions.description: Wetenschappelijk onderzoek en onderwijs (BKO gecertificeerd) op het gebied van gezondheidseconomie aan de Faculty of Health, Medicine en Life Sciences (Vakgroep Health Services Research).
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor

profile_positions.description:
April 1996-April 2012: Werkzaam als Universitair docent bij de Universiteit Maastricht. Van 1996-juni 2011 bij de vakgroep Beleid, Economie en Organisatie van de Zorg. Sinds Juni 2011 bij de vakgroep Health Services Research

Augustus 1990-Maart 1996: Werkzaam als docent bij de vakgroep kwantitatieve economie (Faculteit der Economische Wetenschappen, 1990-1991) en vakgroep Algemene economie (1995-1996) en als AiO (1991-1994).
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor
